page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is a series of erosion surfaces, capped with river gravels and glacial clays and sands, cut into older clays and sands. Small streams issuing from the sands have eroded gemtle valleys. However, the main features of our landscape are influenced by man. The farmland varies from open "prarie" (638922) with straight drainage ditches to small fields with hedgerows (626942). Large residual patches of woodland (603921) have amenity value, whilst other open space is for recreation. The remaining 40% of the area is built-up, but interspearsed with many mature trees. The suburban commuters' houses are arranged in estates. The most remarkable feature of the landscape is the abrupt urban-rural transition along the "Green-Belt" policy.
